issues.title: Mechanism to distribute list of ip ranges
issues.author: chantra
issues.body:
Likely bootstrapped off DNS by using an underscored prefix (say _rdnsipranges.example.com)

One approach would be to leverage good old TXT record. One needs to be wary about the potential size of this record and force TC to avoid amplification. This could be prevented by using a URI mechanism (via specially formatted TXT or actually leveraging a [URI RR type (RFC7553)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7553)?

That URI could lead to a [IP Geolocation feed (RFC8805)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8805).

If TXT, it could probably take the form of "rfc8805:https://example.com/feed ips:2001:db8::/32|iata ips:198.51.100.0/24|iata"....

Capturing this here as it would make a natural contender: [Lists of Address Prefixes (APL RR)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3123), but this would limit to IP ranges only.
